cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continues WNW toward the central Texas coast, then slows and turns north-northeast skirting the upper Texas coast toward southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid-Texas coast between Port O’Connor and Freeport, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (tropical-storm watch, south of the port area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX eastward to Morgan City, LA (includes Sabine Lake/Port Arthur)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: upper Texas coast from Matagorda Bay eastward through Sabine Pass and the southwest Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible beginning late Monday and persisting into Wednesday with a 10 % peak onset probability and 35 % cumulative chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible at Sabine Lake and the Port Arthur waterfront during high tide Monday night through Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches expected with isolated totals up to 20 inches; flash and urban flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents already occurring.
